remarks: The sum of two infinite series (generalized to an arbitrary commutative and associative operation).  (Contributed by NM, 17-Mar-2005.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 30-May-2014.)
statement:
seqcaopr.1 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. S /\ y e. S ) ) -> ( x .+ y ) e. S ) $.
seqcaopr.2 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. S /\ y e. S ) ) -> ( x .+ y ) = ( y .+ x ) ) $.
seqcaopr.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. S /\ y e. S /\ z e. S ) ) -> ( ( x .+ y ) .+ z ) = ( x .+ ( y .+ z ) ) ) $.
seqcaopr.4 $e |- ( ph -> N e. ( ZZ>= ` M ) ) $.
seqcaopr.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. ( M ... N ) ) -> ( F ` k ) e. S ) $.
seqcaopr.6 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. ( M ... N ) ) -> ( G ` k ) e. S ) $.
seqcaopr.7 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. ( M ... N ) ) -> ( H ` k ) = ( ( F ` k ) .+ ( G ` k ) ) ) $.
seqcaopr $p |- ( ph -> ( seq M ( .+ , H ) ` N ) = ( ( seq M ( .+ , F ) ` N ) .+ ( seq M ( .+ , G ) ` N ) ) ) $.
$d .+ k x y z $.
$d F k $.
$d G k $.
$d H k $.
$d M k $.
$d N k $.
$d S k x y z $.
$d k ph x y z $.
